text.tspan: Open source cross-platform MRI Scanner State and Event Monitoring
Vinai Roopchansingh1,3, J. Andrew Derbysire1,3, and Peter A. Bandettini2,1,3
1. Functional MRI Facility, 2. Section on Functional Imaging Methods, 3. National Institute of Mental Health, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD 20892

tspan.tspan: Provide a standard interface which can be used to
determine a MRI scanner's state, regardless of scanner
This will be used to create a set of tools to allow in-
session MRI experiments in a vendor-neutral manner.
only mode) to Linux PC (NFS and Samba
• On Linux PC, parse scanners' logs with
application) to ReST web API. Scanner's state
is published as a Python dictionary.
Current signals detected from each vendor
sequence prepped, Scanner is acquiring data,
Scanner is not acquiring data, Image
registered, Scanner is acquiring data, Scanner
Currently, this software can detect when a
patient or sample is in the scanner, and
whether data acquisition is happening. This is
sufficient for tasks like running in-session QA,
in-session monitoring of patient motion, and
• Find more signals and sources information
that flag behavior on each vendor's platform.
• Explore other APIs to acquire and ingest
sockets, Unix pipes, TTL pulses, system
• Develop software that can query the
published ReST API, and use that information
to drive MRI and FMRI software within the

text.tspan: • Bodurka and Bandettini - Real Time Software
for Monitoring MRI Scanner Operation. 303 T-AM,
